website_summaries.verdict: The minimalist design of this harness is ideal for dogs who don’t like to be weighed down. Lightweight straps offer a barely there feel while a chest leash attachment deters pulling.
pros: Front leash attachment turns dogs around each time they pull or lunge
Light, strappy construction doesn’t interfere with range of motion
Easy to put on and take off
Features sturdy metal connectors and robust plastic buckles
Fully adjustable to fit most builds
Available in a wide array of colors
cons: Thin straps may cause some rubbing behind front legs, especially with short haired breeds

customer_reviews.title: Irritation and scabbing after just one walk
customer_reviews.text: I have used PetSafe harnesses before, but I must say - this one is absolutely horrible. There's no padding whatsoever and my dog has very obvious discomfort after just one walk with it on. I followed the directions within the packet and fitted it properly - this is clearly an issue with the harness itself. I will be returning it - I should have listened to the negative reviews more. There is NO reason that this harness should have created lacerations and irritation after ONE walk. Horrible product, I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: This Harness actually does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Walking a yellow lab was a bit of a workout as she just pulled - even with a non punitive choke collar. She was beginning to respond but being a hard headed lab .... well, you know the story. Fast forward to this Easy Walk Harness. Story changed significantly - after a week in the harness she walks with a slack lead most of the time and is more responsive to command. This harness works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Aut

customer_reviews.title: Damaged my French Bulldog
customer_reviews.text: Hank is the typical French Bulldog: 28lbs of muscle and 100lbs of pull. He’s a bully and that’s what they do. I trusted the reviewers on this collar and learned the hard way, not everything “guaranteed”, 4.5 stars, and “pet-friendly” really works. At first Hank walked very well because it was new. However, now that he’s use to it the effect is gone. We noticed his hair wearing wearing off and sores forming under both armpits from abrasion. This collar ruined my dog’s coat! DONE DEAL. I tossed $19.95 in the trash. Now we have a training issue and a damaged dog. This collar doesn’t work on stubborn bulldogs, only hurts them.
customer_reviews.author: coach

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my shepherd mix. He’s roughly 85 lbs and I purchased this product in hopes that it would help with his excessive pulling when out on walks. I first purchased the XL size according to the measurements. When the XL size arrived, it was too big and returned it for the L size. We have tightened the harness according to his body. So far each time we’ve use it, he has managed to slip a leg out. This product just might not be suitable for his size/ build. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Jannet

customer_reviews.title: Honestly a bit scared to use it
customer_reviews.text: Both times I've used it, it works really well on my 7lb terrier mix when he does a light charge. However, when he goes full ham, he's managed to get a leg out and he is so freaked out by the half in half out that he gets more and more tangled and worried. I've gone over the instructions half a dozen times and it seems like we are using it correctly. He can just get out of it super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Reads

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have literally have went through 4 different collars/harnesses for my dog. All of them claiming to help with leash pulling but they all failed miserably. A friend told me about this harness, I was sceptacle but decided to buy it anyway because I was out of options. From the moment I put this harness on my dog, the pulling decreased dramatically! I have only had this harness for about a week, and every day gets even better. If you have a dog that will not stop pulling no matter what you do, this harness will be your best friend. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Don't even consider another brand
customer_reviews.text: Works instantly no training period required. My dog went from insanely embarrassing chasing squirrels at the park knocking me over to walking "nicely" IMMEDIATELY. Worth ten times the price. The owner of a Rottweiler approached me and told me about this harness one day at the dog park. I was obviously having problems with my new dog. When the dog tries to pull it spins the dog around. Soooooo, no more pulling if they want to get anywhere. Works differently than other harnesses.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya B

customer_reviews.title: Magic!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy magically stopped pulling with this harness! It's very nice quality. Takes a minute to figure out how to properly put it on, but once you do it's amazing! IMPORTANT FOR SAFETY! I would definitely NOT leave the dog wearing it without supervision. There is a loop in front and our puppy was putting his lower jaw inside it. He was able to take it out at will, but just in case, don't leave your pup in it without supervision. I've read that the dog can die if the lower jaw gets stuck in a loose collar and there is no one around to help. May be simillar danger with this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Eric&Alexis

customer_reviews.title: This is the only harness that prevent pulling
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 large dogs and the only way to walk them together is to use the easy walk harness. One things that is advertised is that it fits every dog, it does not. One of my dogs, it really irritates under her front legs near her chest and I’ve tried everything to make it fit her correctly and it still hurts her. I had to make a fleece liner to protect her from the harness. It stretches way too much after it gets wet. One of my dogs is a swimmer and I leave it under her life jacket while swimming and once we start walking again, it is way too loose on her until it dries again.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Size adjustments kept loosening and dog almost ripped right through.
customer_reviews.text: Didnt last more than a month for my dog. I adjusted the straps to fit him perfectly, but it would slide back out of place and my dog ended up getting annoyed with the dangling straps and needless to say he just barely ripped it off. Luckily I bought another type of harness as a backup incase this one didnt work. If I hadn't gone to try the fit of the other harness I wouldn't have know he'd almost chewed straight threw this one and would have run loose. Not a great harness for a dog that's smart at getting out of things, or is chewer. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Li

customer_reviews.title: Size did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! My little guy chewed out of it in one day. I followed the directions for size but did not see that I could have gotten a petite small. I thought small was his size. Yet when I received it, it said pounds on it and I would have gotten the smaller one. It was just a little loose in the front but enough that he was able to get his jaws on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lttlebit13

customer_reviews.title: Really adjustable & easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The medium was too big for my medium sized dog (about 35 lb retriever mix). BUT with adjustments to the smallest size it fit her nicely. My point is this product could fit a wide range of sizes. The instructions have very helpful and have easy to understand/ large images. The straps also are labeled (shoulder, belly, etc.) With tiny white tags on the inside. The straps are also color coded. The harness IS durable. If you are looking for something your dog won't chew through you need to see a professional trainer, or stop leaving your harness on your dog after you get home from your walk.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let your dog chew on it
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go on a walk without this harness. Our puppy will still pull HARD if using just his collar. But totally different when using the harness. So easy to use and love the color differences to differentiate which strap goes where. This is the second harness we’ve gone through bc he chewed through the first one, but have been more aware of when he starts biting on the harness and stop him immediately. Usually the strap that goes across his chest, where the leash meets the harness
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this harness for as long as I can remember. I decided to replace them because they were dirty and the buckle was chewed off and was not easy to unbuckle. This time, the harness plastic material is very thin and fragile compared to their old ones. My dog chewed it for a long time but it only made a few dents before. This time, he chewed it for two seconds and it snapped in half. I compared the plastic to the old harness and it was thinner. Everything was a bit different including the nylon thickness and the seam sewing. They must have switched things around to make it cheaper and it shows. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Works well for dogs who like to pull
customer_reviews.text: We have a very stubborn English Lab. And she was pulling so hard on walks with a traditional harness (that clips behind her back) that I couldn't even walk her-- my husband would have to. Now using this harness along with some techniques from a dog trainer, I am able to walk her again without much issue at all. I will say the first time she wore this and tried to take off she face planted into the grass which was kind of funny.... never again though. She learned that lesson. Photo of Ruby after a long walk in her new harness.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany L.

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy again - Easy to use but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these because my pup chewed the first one apart. I have been especially careful with the second one (not leaving it on my dog when not in use). However, I just discovered that she has been able to start chewing the chest strap of the second one. The problem is that the sliding adjustments for the chest strap do not stay in place and the chest strap loosens on its own. I have to tighten it during every walk which is hard to do while my dog is wearing the harness. Apparently it loosened again and she slipped it into her mouth. It chews apart very easily. I will have to find a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Nice product very easy to chew off
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. I dinged it on sturdiness because FYI if you look away a puppy can get to it and chew it off in no time. We left it on Lira briefly while doing something and he was able to chew it in half and now it’s junk. We have a Labrador so he has a lot of chewing in him but is still a puppy. We have been through two of these (I left it once and my husband left one once). These are nice but expensive if this happens. Our fault but because of this I don’t think it is as sturdy as it could be. Any large breed puppy can and probably will do this.
customer_reviews.author: IVRN

customer_reviews.title: Love Love LOve
customer_reviews.text: Once you know to put on the harness like a medal on your dog and only clip and unclip the slightly darker side this is the perfect harness. My dog no longer pulls on walks thanks to the front clip. Its pretty sturdy, especially when you have a dog that literally tries to gnaw free every time she sees a squirrel. The first easy walk she grew out of and it cost us 3x the price of this one. We were pleasantly surprised this cheaper harness worked just as well as the store (petsmart) bought. Trust me its way cheaper here.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: These worked with my pullers IMMEDIATELY, no SERIOUSLY!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs are natural pullers. Our boy has to be alpha and our girl wants to be out front. Good upper arm workout for us but not an enjoyable time. These harnesses worked IMMEDIATELY, no SERIOUSLY! Tekoa stayed chill and Abby slowed her pull. Now after a few walks, it’s enjoyable for us again. I can even walk them both (180lbs combined) with one hand almost effortlessly! Make sure to MEASURE PROPERLY and take your time adjusting them on your dog. The videos all say give two finger widths, but you know your dog. I’ve got ours snug but not tight. Readjustment after a couple times is needed. 🤙🏻🐶
customer_reviews.author: S. Siddle

customer_reviews.title: Ripped apart in 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I used this harness on my labradoodle puppy for six weeks. I did not keep it on him at all times. Yet, this morning, I noticed it had ripped apart at the front. I was shocked. But then I got out my old harness from my late cocker spaniel. It was a PetSafe and I used it for years with no problem. Guess what? I compared the two harnesses and the nylon PetSafe now uses is inferior -- not as thick. Even though my old one looks terrible, I am going to be using it until I figure out a better brand to buy.
customer_reviews.author: AnnPennsylvania

customer_reviews.title: Rubs badly & dog can slip out
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several harnesses for my Boston terrier and this is by far the worst. I bought it becyof the “no pull” feature. Could never get the fit right (on its tightest chest setting it was too loose, but the part across the back was WAY too tight - when the back was adjusted correctly the chest was so loose he stepped out of it). Twice, it slipped part way off on our walk. Worst of all, it rubbed my poor puppy’s skin red & rubbed hair off so I threw it out & went back to Gooby harnesses. I’m so upset this product was so uncomfortable for my puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You’ve tried everything but have you tried this?
customer_reviews.text: I have an 80lb Yellow Lab/German Shepherd mix. He was fine walking around home but walking him downtown was a literal nightmare. He’s afraid of some strangers, flags, signs, garbage cans, doors flinging open, you name it. When he pulled I really felt it and was in pain. I doubted this product would work because I had a different brand of “no pull” harness that did not have as many areas to adjust for sizing as this one does. If you’ve tried everything except this, please take the chance to try. Your back and dog will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: No way to contact seller and broken product in less than 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: I have used these before with out any issue. I had one of these for my current dog but it was worn and I got him a new one. I have had this harness for about 24 hours and it is already broken. I looked all over to find a way to contact the seller for a replacement. I can't seem to find an email or anything. I'm not sure why this was so flimsy but these have always worked great in the past. I'm hoping to find anyway to talk to the seller and work something out. Definitely not fun to search all over the place for some sort of customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Anges

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this
customer_reviews.text: I would've given this harness 5 stars when it arrived. It's absolutely perfect in design. From our very first walk, this harness completely corrected our dog's on-leash behavior, as she tends to get distracted and tangled up in the leash. Problem solved! Unfortunately, the harness is fraying badly at the stress points on the harness. This occurred after only a few uses. I don't think our dog is an exceptionally strong puller-- certainly, nothing that would cause this type of damage. At any rate, I am afraid to use it now. I'm looking for a sturdier version of this excellent design.
customer_reviews.author: CBS

customer_reviews.title: Not good for pit bulls
customer_reviews.text: The harness is good quality. It stays adjusted even if my dog pulls... many harnesses I've used in the past loosen up throughout the length of our walks. However, I have a pit bull and she's very wide in the chest so the "no pull" feature doesn't really work. The idea is that if your dog pulls the harness kind of squeezes their front legs together to stop them. My pup is so stocky and wide across the chest that even when the piece in the front pulls together to squeeze her legs it doesn't really do much. That being said, the front clipping area for the leash is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: About to Break After Only Three Months!
customer_reviews.text: We bought one in August 2015 and three months later it ALREADY has two very worn spots, one of which is about to break all the way through - see the attached photo. It gets normal use (no extended long-distance running or anything) and only for about half the walks with our dog. Another PetSafe Easy Walk Dog Harness that we have - identical to this one, just of a different color - is ten months old and has NOT worn out like this! SO buyer beware: some of these seem to not be as sturdily constructed as others!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: No impressed. My dog was still able to get himself out of this even tightly adjusted. Went to dog training class and they specifically said this is a bad training tool and suggested a cheap 7 dollar metal collar that worked immediately which he still wears to this day. Can’t chew threw metal and impossible to back out of it. Do your homework. Pass on this and get the right collar.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great for pullers, not an all day harness
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my dogs. They fit great, they're light weight and they do a good job with stopping them from pulling. On the downside, one of my dogs did manage to chew through one of the straps on the harness and break it. If it's only being used to go on walks, and not to wear throughout the day (or in my dogs case-during an unsupervised bathroom break outside) then I would say it's a great harness. if your dog likes to chew things then don't keep it on them if you're not in sight.
customer_reviews.author: mugen_edamame

customer_reviews.title: Night and day difference!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 11month old Dane mix perfectly, with still some room to grow. She pulled so much on her other harness I thought she’d done permanent damage to my shoulder. Got this and not even exaggerating, her walks were 100% better. If she pulls, even all 102lbs of her, it whips her right around to look at me, and I barely feel it. I can confidently take her and the double stroller on walks. On bad part is, now she won’t pull the stroller up all the hills for me. LOL
customer_reviews.author: G's mama

customer_reviews.title: Has stopped the pulling
customer_reviews.text: This is the only harness that has helped stop my pug from pulling ahead on walks. In obedience class she was perfect, even off leash, but on walks she was like a racehorse. This harness has really helped and walks are much more pleasant now. The only issue I have is the fit is just not right. When it fits around the chest, it's too big around the front. I exchanged for a smaller size. It's better but we still have the same problem. I wish it was able to be adjusted more for these broad chested dogs. Still, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Lover

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot give this harness enough praise! I had become incredibly frustrated with our newly adopted 1yo mutt. He had started pulling out of control on a walk and I couldn't take it any more! And we couldn't take him anywhere! Since the moment we started with the harness, it's been an incredible change that makes walking pleasurable. He's easy to manage and doesn't want to pull. We love it and can't stop recommending to other pully-dog owners! He's a 60 lb lab/pointer/hound and wears an M/L size. The easywalk website has a great diagram to help with fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BROKE ON THE FIRST DAY
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my 40ish pound dog, she is 7 months old. Took her outside for a very short walk around the yard. She did her thing, rolled in the grass, laid down and then came inside. I left it on her while she napped. After her nap she started to play and within minutes the harness was broken. This harness was not on her too tightly or too loosely. I did my best according to the very thorough instructions provided. The instructions were great. The product seemed to work well as she wasn't pulling, however it broke in under an hour, on the first day. VERY DISAPPOINTED. RETURNING.
customer_reviews.author: Shopperbyreviews

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect, no pulling!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 month 22lb mini goldendoodle. I measured and purchased a size Medium, and it fit perfectly when tightened, with room to grow into it. My first walk with him wearing it went great- no pulling through the park! I was pleasantly surprised at how quick this worked for my pup. I can't speak to durability, as I have not had it long enough, but it doesn't seem like my puppy can chew on it while its on, and I don't keep it in a place where he can chew on it while its off....
customer_reviews.author: Katie Bennett

customer_reviews.title: A good harness to help alleviate pulling
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a 74lb lab mix and can and will still pull me when properly motivated , i.e. he sees a squirrel or cat or tasty bit of food . This harness helps alleviate most of pulling on daily walks . It also spins them around if they bolt and you have them on a retractable lead providing you can hold on , so this harness works best on a short to mid range lead. I am on my second harness in 8 years. The first one the plastic buckle developed some wear and at times would come unbuckled if he laid on it wrong. It's the best harness I have found to eliminate pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Losten Deforest

customer_reviews.title: Discomfort in the armpits.
customer_reviews.text: Got this harness for our boxer because she pulls uncontrollably and someone had recommended this harness to us. It works great because you can attach the leash to the front of their chest, which makes them pull less. The one thing I am disappointed in, is the comfort for my dog. The harness rubs against the armpits and was giving my dog blisters and she did not like it at all. Now I have to start looking for another harness that is comfortable for our dog.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I like this, it works great! My dog is in between sizes so sometimes she uses a large or medium. Return was easy to change sizes. I do not know of a 100% chew proof harness out there but if they do exist I don't think they will be this affordable. My own dog ate 4 harnesses and a collar the first month I brought her home. It took extensive training and positive reinforcement to break the behaviour. Another option I adopted is keep the harness off her unless we need to use it. I don't think my dog ate harnesses because the manufacturer did a terrible
customer_reviews.author: Danie-rich

customer_reviews.title: Not for Chewers
customer_reviews.text: This design is great for my dogs to stop pulling when walking. It seems sturdy and durable unless you have a dog that chews things. I tried several different harnesses and this was the only design that worked for us. However in less than a day it was chewed through and I did not leave it on my dog for very long at all. Before I knew it she had chewed through the thin material. I purchased another harness with the same design only thicker material and it has been working well. I would recommend this if the dog is not a chewer.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two easy walkers. This harness is a game changer when walking with both a golden retriever lab mix and a Staffordshire bull terrier (pit bull) They are puppies learning thier walking manners and this harness has made a huge difference and made our walks enjoyable. The medium fits great on my 7month old tall and lean golden lab mix and it fit my pit when she was under a year old. The medium isn't big enough for her broad chest now. The large fits well on my 65lb 1 year old pit. (Picture is showing medium)
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Redirects strong determined Jack Russell!
customer_reviews.text: Love this harness. Makes walking my very determined and strong jack Russell much easier and less strain on my shoulders. It redirects him when he pulls and I give him a command of “slow down” before he reaches the end of the lead. After having a shoulder injury this has been a life saver. The first one we received was a little large and he was able to chew on it. I called the company, they sent me a smaller size at minimal cost. The fact that they replaced it for less than $8 and will do that twice if needed in a lifetime is a pretty good warranty.
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA

customer_reviews.title: Dog walks great
customer_reviews.text: This harness worked wonders for my black lab. She loves to pull on her collar, and was choking herself on every walk, and my wife who is close in weight to the dog could not walk her because she'd get pulled along. With this collar our dog walks very nicely and we were able to take her out in public to events we'd otherwise be unable to. That being said in those confined areas with lots of people, it does take away a bit of control you'd have with a collar, but it's a worthwhile trade-off. Figured I'd try these hoping they'd work, and it definitely paid off.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fit
customer_reviews.text: My dog won't sit still long enough to measure her...bought the large by the measurements I did get. I have it cinched as tight as it can go and it seems too loose. That said, she does not seem to pull as hard - but she still pulls. Ordered a medium- large padded style and arranged to return this one; however, the sizing is no better. Now not sure which one to keep or just return both...not really ready to venture out to a local pet store to have her fitted in person but this is probably what I will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: AWC

customer_reviews.title: These are a game changer!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 labs. They've both been to extensive training, and they both still like to pull on their leashes. We've tried gentle leaders, electric collars, other harnesses, martingale collars... As soon as we put the PetSafe Easy Walk harnesses on they immediatly stopped pulling! I mean, I can walk them both my myself. That never would have happened before! Our labs are 45 pounds and 60 pounds and the Medium/Large fits both of them. This was recommended by a friend and I am so grateful!
customer_reviews.author: ErinNicole

customer_reviews.title: Miracle!
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly! This is like a miracle harness! After having a dislocated shoulder and torn rotator cuff, being dragged literally on my face 25 feet and numerous other instances of being chucked around by my St.Bernard, I can easily control him with little effort. Whomever invented this deserves a medal, like seriously. If he starts to pull(like he dies A LOT) when he sees a motorcycle or skateboard or bicycle or pretty much anything that moves, he gets pulled to the side and realizes he isn't going to drag me around so he just stops. I cannot express how happy I am that I purchased this, like seriously!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Kawcak

customer_reviews.title: Holy ****!
customer_reviews.text: This is life changing. I don't understand the magick imbued in these small straps, but good gracious does it work wonders. I have just adopted a 20 month old pitbull and she has on leash reactivity. To the point she was strangling herself trying to go meet (or eat, unclear) a cat. Now I can walk past barking dogs, and she may dig in a little, and whine some, but also comes along with a gentle tug. I'm completely shocked how well this works. This is under priced. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Morse

customer_reviews.title: Finally he doesn't take us for a walk!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Not too hard to put on, especially with the label tabs on the harness that show "shoulder, chest.. etc." My 80# 10 year old Rhodesian Boxer didn't pull at all, after he tried once! I hated walking my dog before, with my 20+ year old wrist injury taking a beating every time.. My 9 year old daughter was even able to walk him! The coloring was a lot more florescent though.. which ended up being a good thing for us, because it matches his collar that we already had, perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Cuzzisaidso0

customer_reviews.title: Instantly changes pulling behavior!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky getting this on my dog the first time as she is a wriggly worm! But I was so pleased that she barely pulled at all when we went for a long walk. Do note that this harness is not meant to be a cure-all, your dog should be trained to keep focus on you at all times. My dog is learning that but there has been the occasional pulling when she sees another dog in the distance -- this is helping a LOT to control her until we are all dialed in on the training. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Renfrow

customer_reviews.title: GREAT harness- Potentially need to size down
customer_reviews.text: First, harnesses with front clips work best with my puller- so of course this harness is great for us. I own a 2 Hounds Freedom harness and I love it, but I also like to add bandanas when we go out in public, so I wanted a more basic harness that would keep him from looking bulky. Cons: The strap that goes across his chest can sometimes slip down, which I think looks uncomfortable, but I ordered a L and maybe should have gone with a M instead.. Tank isn’t bothered by it at all, so I’ll continue using this harness regardless. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Faline✨

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size medium in green for my border collie. The harness feels high quality and is a nice grey/green color. My dog is a frantic leash puller and it has been very hard to leash train her. Because of her pulling she becomes more aggressive on the leash because she strangles herself. No kidding, first time she wore this she walked on the leash without pulling and showed no aggression while out walking. This leash seems a little uncomfortable for her because it keeps her from being able to run but she has learned to slow down and I’m so happy I bought this harness.
customer_reviews.author: JadeOli

customer_reviews.title: Not like the original Easy Walk
customer_reviews.text: We had an original Easy Walk for 7 years with our Bernese, so as soon we had a new Bernese Puppy we bought this one, now owned by Petsafe. What a disappointment, we’ve been using it for about 5 weeks and it’s completely destroyed. Our puppy is 4 months old and weighs 42 Lbs now. Imagine this breaking in the middle of a street crossing. Terrible quality, it’s a shame since the harness works great. Now we’ve got a new one... different brand.
customer_reviews.author: MARCOSSK

customer_reviews.title: Torn After Five Months
customer_reviews.text: We a first liked this halter for walking our Goldendoodle. However, as he was pulling last week towards another dog the front strap ripped completely in half! The rip occurred in the front strap that goes across the chest in the same spot shown by other reviewers. I would not buy this again, and will spend a little more for a better halter from a different company that will last longer. I think the metal buckle used to tighten the strap causes it to rip eventually. This company did not stand by their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ligon

customer_reviews.title: It works for my cocker spaniel!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: we had it for just a few weeks when it ripped apart at the clasp. Luckily we were already back inside before it completely broke off. Not refundable either, apparently. It's a shame because it worked well. I've tried training, other harnesses, you name it to get my dog to stop pulling on every walk. It was so frustrating! But this actually works!!! He does pull a little at first, only to realize that with this harness, his pulling is no good. Then he will walk normal. Its like a breath of fresh air! to walk my dog!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Stops pulling
customer_reviews.text: My dog pulls like crazy and this harness actually works so well for her! She's a 45 lb pitbull mix but pure muscle, so she's so much stronger than you'd think. On the collar after just a few minutes my arm is so tired but on this harness I barely feel tension on the leash. It clips in the front, so it's a little annoying that the leash gets caught under her leg, but the design is great because it puts pressure on her shoulders where her legs move, which helps to stop the puling. Be careful with the settings, it took awhile to get exactly the right fit and it chafed under her armpits until we got it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: No more pulling!
customer_reviews.text: These babies really worked! My pups would drag me down the street regularly, and if they saw a squirrel I'd get my shoulder yanked out of it's socket. Right out of the package these worked and I have been using them ever since. If your pup tries to bolt the front attachment pulls them toward you preventing them from charging off. My only issue is one of my pups is a chewer and she has chewed her way through two of these when sitting in the car unobserved. So the moral to that story is don't put them on them when they will be out of sight. Otherwise, perfection!
customer_reviews.author: caeden

customer_reviews.title: Love this harness
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my newly adopted dog who wasn’t leash trained. For the first few days we had to carry him (50 lbs!!) from the car to the house lol. After several long walks he got the hang of it and this helped. It kind of pushes their legs forward to force walking and also when you pull it creates a diversion if they were after a squirrel for example. Love it ! He was a m/l
customer_reviews.author: Amy Toledo

customer_reviews.title: 'Large' for 65 pound plott hound - boxer mix, mild barrel chest.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third of these, because my mom keeps leaving them on the floor for my dog to eat, which he obligingly does with great speed. I tried a number of different harnesses from Amazon and this was the one that adjusted to fit my dog snuggly at all points. It does almost exactly what it needs to do, though if he's really losing his mind (he's leash reactive) and you don't move him along, he can wiggle out of it within a few frantic minutes. For buying some time for us to get out of the situation, though, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: CynBio

customer_reviews.title: Size Adjusters slip
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in teal in a medium size for a dog that out grew a smaller one of the same brand. We did not have the problem of the front chest strap sizers slipping with the other one. Since our dog is pretty used to wearing this style of harness it does not cause too much problems that it loosens up like that, but if this is something you want to use to train your pup, than you'll probably be disappointed. Wich it was the same great product we bought the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Wicked Stepmother

customer_reviews.title: Not great for long-term wearing
customer_reviews.text: Up until this past week, I would’ve given these 5 stars. It wasn’t until we went on a long day hike that we learned they were rubbing the dog’s skin raw! Our longer haired dog has never had issues with harnesses because her fur is thick, but our short haired boy always seems to have some sort of rubbing. We didn’t realize how bad it was until we got home and noticed he was bleeding For shorter walks, I highly recommend them. They pull the dog’s legs out so they can’t keep pulling. Great when you have reactive dogs. Find something else for long walks if you have pullers
customer_reviews.author: K. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: difficult to adjust properly and just does not seem to work
customer_reviews.text: we fiddled with this harness for an hour and it just does not seem to work. the size is proper for the dog, but it still pulls around to the side of the dog when walking making it very awkward for the poor dog. its just too complicated too many straps too many adjustment points. we gave up and kept using old collar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my dog trainer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it is the only one my dog trainer recommends. I don't get how it's a no pull because my dog still pulls, but she's a very large dog. I only put it on when we go out and I don't have to worry about it coming off like the collar sometimes does. The ring on the collar under the neck hangs pretty low and the trainer had me hook the lease to both the harness and the dog's collar which works very well. I sometimes get confused about how to put it on, but just remember the lighter color go under the chest. It's a good harness and I'm glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I can finally walk my 7 mo. Corgi puppy with a certain amount of dignity and control! believe that the fit is "almost" like what instructions call for as she falls into the Sm/Med category and I'm sure she will need an upgrade in size as she matures. She can still pull if she is barked at by other dogs and gets excited, but she is controllable better than with a standard collar and that will be up to me to get her to ignore big distractions like barking dogs. This is a good product; it really works.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Not practical
customer_reviews.text: Logically, you would think the attachment to the leash would be on the top (back) of the dog. This allows for less tanglement. But the pictures seem to represent putting it on the chest of the dog. This created such a problem with walking my lab. The leash got stuck against front legs and then under the leg. It was clumsy and I had to stop several times to "untangle". Not sure why this design is like this, but it worked better when the ring was on top.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Helped my dog stop pulling.
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a problem pulling on her leash and this was recommended by her trainer. Along with some training tips this really works well. It took about 3- 4 months before she stopped pulling but it was worth the wait. I put her back on her harness and she's fine now. I keep it just in case. The only problem I had with this harness was that rubbed her skin in the beginning and gave her a little mark at first. But I just put some ointment on it and it cleared up. Then it didn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mo

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed. Was sent wrong size.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is 5 stars. It’s great quality and as pictured, but not as described. I ordered a size “medium/large.” I was sent a “medium.” Now the sticker from the seller that has been placed on the package says “medium/large,” but the actual package and product says, “medium,” and is too small for my dog. I am returning this and ordering the correct size from Chewy.com as amazon seems to take forever to actually refunds monies these days.
customer_reviews.author: ZorayaJo

customer_reviews.title: Best harness!
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best harness I have found for my dog! We have tried several different kinds and liked the PugLife harness until my dog figured out how to "escape" by backing out of it. I was initially leery about the front clip vs. back, but found that this keeps my dog from pulling. It doesn't actually "stretch", but is easily adjustable to different chest and neck sizes. It's very reasonably priced and love the color options. I would definitely recommend the PetSafe Easy Walk Harness!
customer_reviews.author: Jackpot

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing but not like it used to be
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th dog I bought a gentle leader. The last time I bought a gentle leader halter was 11 years ago. The design has changed in the front where the leash is attached. It does not seem to hug the front of the dog like the other 3 I had in the past. It is not the size, the size seems perfect. With my previous pups they had no choice but to walk perfectly. This version is not the same. My dog can still pull. While this is better than nothing, I am sorry that it no longer works like it used to.
customer_reviews.author: Debo

customer_reviews.title: Stops the pulling
customer_reviews.text: Upon adopting our beautiful Bordernese, I came to realize that perhaps hell consists of being pulled across the street, dodging cars while the pup chases a squirrel. When other dogs or humans would approach, I'd cringe at the forthcoming barking and pulling fit that would inevitably ensue. No longer! With this harness, she goes to oull my arm off and ends up spinning around and looking bewildered. Whoever designed this, I love you!
customer_reviews.author: Auntiji

customer_reviews.title: Helped the pulling
customer_reviews.text: I have a feisty corgi, and it helped her to not pull. But I wonder if it’s comfortable for her because her leash latch hits her shoulder as she’s a small pup. I keep asking myself if that’s making her sore, but obviously you can’t ask them lol But it is the only thing that helped my corgi to not pull while we’re walking. I’ve hired trainers and she still pulls, specially when she sees another dog or squirrel. I have a lot more control over her with this harness.
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: No pulling, honest.
customer_reviews.text: I love this harness. I use it for walks and chaining up my dog. It’s lightweight but strong. She chewed through the first one I got her when she was into chewing anything she could find, and the seller replaced it for me, I think it was for free! I see people walking their dogs who are pulling and I want to tell them to get one of these. If I hook a leash up to her collar, she pulls and coughs and chokes herself, but I can hold the leash with one finger when I use this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy walk Harness makes walks more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased many of these for ver the years and love them. However, if your dog likes to jump or lunge, this might not be your best option as it may not give you enough control. That said, this harness works great if you have a dog that likes to pull. If you do need to make a correction, it does no harm to the dog’s neck and the dog quickly learns to walk along side you and not out in front.
customer_reviews.author: RockA

customer_reviews.title: Caused Skin Reaction - Wash Before Use
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving two stars because the harness is sturdy and the last one (same brand) lasted for YEARS. About a week after I started using this harness on my dog he got a ring of bumps in the exact area where the harness touches him. I took him to the vet and got medicine for the reaction, washed the harness and his bumps are mostly gone. But that leash turned out to be very expensive at $200 for the vet bill. Yes, it would've been wise of me to wash it beforehand either way, but I think the manufacturer should be more responsible with the products they're selling and make sure they're safe for use - out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: halley

customer_reviews.title: The leash works great for preventing a dog from pulling
customer_reviews.text: The leash works great for preventing a dog from pulling, however, my dog had the same chaffing problem as others mentioned in their reviews. Just scroll down the reviews for any with 1 or 2 stars to read others who had the same issue. The first few weeks seem to be great, but just last night I noticed my 14lb terrier had a pretty bad cut/scrape under his leg (armpit area). The cut was bad enough to have left blood on the harness. Sounds like the leash may work great for some, but I highly suggest you monitor the chaffing particularly if you have a short hair dog. I am returning this product immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible and not at all to train a dog how to walk on a leash or even assist with training them how. My dog slipped right out of it like butter and it was on her good no it wasn’t too big I measured her. Thankfully she only wanted to go back in the house and ran right to my door and waited on me to come open it. Had she been a runner I’d be even more upset. Returned it within an hour of receiving and attempting to use.
customer_reviews.author: CharB

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a gentle leader works better for dogs that like to put everything in their mouth.
customer_reviews.text: We are struggling to teach our lab-mix puppy (7mos, as of this review) not to pull. This harness seems to be comfortable, and she pulls less than when a leash is just strapped to her collar. However, due to her desire to eat everything she sees on the sidewalk, I prefer walking her with a gentle leader. Then I have control over her head. We use this collar for more casual leash use, like hanging out at kid's soccer games. The medium should fit her (according to the online description) but it doesn't get quite tight enough in the chest section. I'm sure it'll be fine in a month or two.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi M

customer_reviews.title: Your arms will thank you!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a god send. I have 2 very strong 50ish pound lab/pit mix's. They love to walk and run and sniff everything and if it wasn't for using this type of harness they'd probably have ripped my arms off by now. If you adjust it correctly (follow the directions!!) and train them with it (encourage no pulling!!) then your arms will thank you too. I also love that they come in a few cute colors too so they're not just boring black. I recommend this harness to anyone with a dog that pulls!
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best no pull harness... by far!
customer_reviews.text: It’s like night and day. This is the best option if you have a strong dog who pulls on leash. I just received this today so I can’t account for durability of the harness but I can tell you that walking my dog is so much easier. He can’t pull anymore. But he also enjoyed his walk and appeared comfortable. After following the directions, adjusting the harness was easy. Don’t try to do it without following the directions though lol I highly recommend this harness. It’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Zach's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Puppy needed bigger size
customer_reviews.text: I had been having a tug-a-war with my puppy trying to pull on her leash. I bought this leash specifically to stop her from pulling while walking. This is my 3rd leash - lst one broke right under her chin where I attached her leash. The ring wears the cord down. The 2nd leash she outgrew so now on third. She behaves well until very close to friends then tries to jump up; but I nudge her down. I replaced the ring under her chin because it pulled apart. Still love the leash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm is easy to fit.
customer_reviews.text: I discovered these volunteering at the local animal shelter. They use them to walk dogs that are strong pullers and they really work. They are sturdy and well made, easy to get on and off. I bought two for my own dogs, who while not strong pullers, can get excited by the presence of another dog and will lunge. After just a few days of using the easy walker that behavior has abated. Much better than having the dog pull on a collar around its neck.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaer

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!!
customer_reviews.text: This harness works amazing! My dog loves to run after squirrels and bunnies on our walks and with past harnesses can end up running towards them three legged as the harness tries to curb her enthusiasm. This one is both comfortable as well as functional. No more pulling! I also enjoy that there are two ways to secure or release it, with a clasp under the legs or neck. Sometimes our pup gets anxious and having more than one way to get it on/off really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing harness for pullers!
customer_reviews.text: This harness works amazing for pullers. It makes the dog turn sideways toward you if they pull so my insane puller walks great on this leash now. The only thing was the other day she got scared from a motorcycle and pulled behind me actually pulling the harness off and almost gave me a heart attack. Thankfully she had a collar on I was able to grab before she took off and hold her until I was able to get the harness back on. Just always make sure you have a backup collar on your dog when using this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Loosens with repeated pulling causing chaffing
customer_reviews.text: The actual harness seems sturdy. The color red is nice and vibrant and goes well against my dog’s brindle coat. However, I had to constantly adjust the straps as they kept losening as my dog would pull repeatedly. I adjusted to the instructions stated, but the constant losening resulted in my dog chaffing at the sites where the harness was. Especially in her arm pit areas. After constant adjustments for weeks, I gave up. It did work well for my dogs pulling and like I said the harness was attractive with good quality, but the issue I stated above made it totally useless for me and my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Spreadasmile

customer_reviews.title: Love this Harness for All my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these harnesses for over ten years in training and everyday use. My labs are all strong and happy to get going. Some have started with the harness as puppies, some as young adults, but all have become great walking companions partly because of this harness. I Highly recommended, and often do, to any dog walker that has a dog that likes to get ahead or tries to pull. It gently redirects with little to no effort and no harm to dog.
customer_reviews.author: BLHswH

customer_reviews.title: It works great but size chart is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: We have always used the Easy Walk harnesses for all our dogs as they work great. That said they must have updated their size charts and not it's not easy to use nor is it accurate. They use to list different breads and you could size match from there. Now they went to straight measurements and they do not need accurate. Too small. Once we got the right size for our pup it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Chester629

customer_reviews.title: Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference walking my 60lb puppy around is! He doesn't drag or pull me, and it works extra great with a short leash. Walking him around the neighborhood is so much easier, every time I take it off the wall he gets so excited he lets me put it on him no problem! Walking for both of us has gotten better, he's not pulling me and he's less anxious when we go out because he always has to focus on me and less on all the outside stimulation!
customer_reviews.author: V.M.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this product - works extremely well for my two dogs
customer_reviews.text: My 6-year-old lab/hound mix was REALLY bad at pulling when she was in a regular harness on walks. We got this and she immediately 110% improved. We just rescued a 5-month-old sheepdog/hound/lab mix (he’ll likely be around 80+ pounds) and this immediately helped him learn how to walk on the leash. It’s super easy to clip them into the harness (it has tags on it that say belly and chest so you know which way to put it on) and then you’re good to go. I couldn’t recommend this more - my husband and I wish we found/bought this so much sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: these have never really worked for my dog
customer_reviews.text: so, maybe its just the odd shape of my dog, but these harnesses, in all different sizes that i've tried, just dont really work on my dog. she's able to shift and pull out of it all the time no matter how tight or small. it rubs to the point where it's uncomfortable on her armpits but she's still able to get out of it. i've tried all sorts of configurations and adjustments, but it just hasn't worked for her. she works a lot better with harnesses that have cloth centers through the chest, if that makes any sense. i would've loved if this worked for my pup, but sadly it didn't :(
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Liu

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend for your dog , inferior nylon material
customer_reviews.text: The nylon material is inferior in comparison to other manufacturers. My dog chewed right through it within seconds once he got his mouth around the strap. They offer a chew replacement but with a fee including shipping which comes out to a few dollars less than the original cost. I am moving on to another product brand that I know will back up their product with a good warranty program and have the customers pocket book and time in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great until it failed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October 2016, really didn't use until spring 2017 and only 10-15 times. Worked great until recently the nylon broke near the adjustment clip when my dog was wearing it. No, it wasn't chewed before. Just a shoddy design. I would have given it a 5 but I contacted customer service several times and got no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Moonshadeau

customer_reviews.title: Irritated/scabbed skin
customer_reviews.text: This product did help with walking our shepherd mix puppy, unfortunately it was because of pain compliance. Took us a while to notice irritated/red skin where the harness makes contact in front (chest) and under front legs (arm pit ish area). 6 month old puppy has scabs in those same areas where harness makes contact. Product should be padded in my opinion. Won’t be using it again until it has some sort of padding. Harness was put on the puppy to be comfortable, not too tight or loose.
customer_reviews.author: Kuczus

customer_reviews.title: Best harness for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a puller. This harness has worked great for those times he darts after a bird or squirrel. Turns him right to me to redirect. I use it on our daily walks, as well as running several times a week. This is actually our second one. I had our first one for about a year and 1/2 & it started to fray on the side. Not sure how it happen, but maybe daily use? Hope the new one lasts even longer.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Too much work
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been in this for months. I’m in the process of finding a new harness. It rubs his arm pit raw on one side. The clasps don’t stay in place and it gets loose again, and we don’t always walk with him in a “heel” position so maybe it’s just not meant for him if you’re not constantly correcting him and training him. We need the front clip because he pulls so much and this did help but it’s rather awkward. Maybe it’s us and not the harness but it gets loose to when wet as our dog likes to swim. I now take it off of him on hikes when he’s free so it doesn’t rub.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect if it fit
customer_reviews.text: I have a terrier mix who is 21 pounds. The small was too small. The medium is too big. The S/M would work, but there isn’t enough room to adjust the straps. As far as the use. It does work. He immediately stopped pulling. I’d suggest your dog wear a collar and clip the leash to the collar and the harness so the harness doesn’t droop and slap against your dogs legs.
customer_reviews.author: Cha

customer_reviews.title: Small/Medium for 24 lb Cocker Spaniel
customer_reviews.text: I have a 24 lb cocker spaniel. Despite his small size he is a PULLER. He loves his walks and walks very quickly and with definite purpose. I ordered the small/medium for him and it is just barely small enough. I probably could have gotten away with a small. It's easy to put on (clearly marked which strap goes where) and REALLY helps with his pulling. I also tried the gentle leader that goes around his snout, that was a massive fail, he hated it. This is perfect! The picture doesn't have the harness in it but I'm posting it so you can see his size for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: Has made a world of a difference in my puppy's walks
customer_reviews.text: My six-month-old lab mix has made a complete 180 in the 6 weeks or so that I've been using this harness. I was using a martingale collar on her after she outgrew her puppy harness, but whenever she saw another dog, she would rather choke herself trying to pull to say hi to it than wait until we got close enough. She's since stopped pulling and calmly walks beside me or a step behind me. She will pull a bit when she wants to say hi to another dog, but can quickly be redirected. I highly recommend! (PS She's 38 lbs and still growing, but a medium fits her well)
customer_reviews.author: cdrown

customer_reviews.title: Worked after many others didnt
customer_reviews.text: After trying all kinds of things a pinch and prong collar and lots of yelling and I even put a collar around my dog's waist because he didn't pull as much but it looks stupid and this harness finally got my dog to mostly stop pulling and I combined it with a bungee cord type leash that has a long and a short handle and especially if I see something that's going to make him want to pull coming I grab the short handle and hold him right beside me lift a little off of weight off of his front feet and he does not pull.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Cady Moore

customer_reviews.title: SIZING IS OFF....AT LEAST 2" Smaller than size chart
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally threw the packaging away so I can't return it but the sizing is WRONG! My dog is 14 lbs and measures 18" girth (pug/chi) so I ordered a small thinking there was some wiggle room. Well, the belly strap hooks in her armpit which of course, is not pleasant and I cannot get it repositioned. It barely snaps although the size chart says girth up to 21". Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Patty D

customer_reviews.title: Keep control of a big dog
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!!! This is a life saver!!! We adopted a german shepherd puppy who at 6 months was already 120 pounds and very strong. We tried a choke collar and a prong collar because that was what everyone recommended but I felt like I was being dragged like a doll whenever he decided to go after something. We got him the large ez walk harness and it fit well. I was absolutely amazed with this product. Now I have full control of the walk. If he tries to lunge or run ahead of me his front legs loose traction and I can easily pull him back. This is a great tool for leash training a big dog.
customer_reviews.author: N Cashin

customer_reviews.title: 100% stopped my dog from pulling!
customer_reviews.text: This harness works immediately in reducing the pulling from your dog. It has to be put on snug (which a lot of dogs hate), so watch a tutorial video for proper fit. It 100% stopped my 45lb, 5 month old retriever from pulling. He had been pulling so hard with a regular collar that his eye were bulging! This prevents him from pulling and he doesn’t even try. Worked from the second I put it on. I have to trick him with a treat to get it over his head because he hates the feel of it on.
customer_reviews.author: Michele L.

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and good fit
customer_reviews.text: I measured my dog and ordered according to their size chart. My dog still pulls some with it on, but I've been trying to give her a little more freedom after using the gentle leader for the first 4 years of her life. If she pulls too much with it, I switch her back to the gentle leader. (I have a German Shorthaired Pointer. Never have I had such a strong dog!!)
customer_reviews.author: Chris Drinnon

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My 9 1/2 month old Great Dane puppy (106 lbs) is controllable in this harness (she's actually used this harness for a couple of months). She hates the Gentle Leader and trying to walk he with just a regular collar is not possible right now. It's a bit challenging getting this on the right way, but once you get used to it, it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Magic for our goldendoodle
customer_reviews.text: This is our fourth harness and we bought it because we ran into a Labradoodle who was wearing one... We are so grateful! If you have an active enthusiastic puppy and you feel like going for a walk is a little bit more like water skiing then this is the harness for you! Pretty much from day one it’s the normal dog walking experience that we hoped for; it’s magic!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael
